intro: Anemopaegma fiebrigianum, commonly known as the Fiebrigianum anemone, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae, which includes poppies and related species. The plant is characterized by its showy, cup-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or white. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a hairy texture. Anemopaegma fiebrigianum thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats.
